KnowledgeBase.Title: Example Symbol compare 002
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: compareEQ compareNE compareGT compareGE compareLT compareLE

Example.Description: These examples use the compare function to compare two Symbols and returns the result in numeric value. In these examples, lowercase characters in the Symbol are compared as against uppercase characters. In the ASCII table, uppercase characters are represented by 65 to 90 while lowercase characters are repsented by 97 to 122. Using this table, lowercase characters have greater value than uppercase characters.

Syntax.Note:
In this example, "y" in the first string has a higher value in the ASCII
table than "i", therefore the first symbol is greater than the second symbol.

In this example, "G" in the first symbol has a lesser value in the ASCII
table than uppercase "H", therefore the first symbol is lesser than the second symbol.
